fanquake: woah
[bitcoin] vasild opened pull request #33843: test: add tests for private broadcast (master...private_broadcast_tests) https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33843
rip drahtbot
I'm wondering if the newest AI anti-spam features, have triggered some GH anti-spam feature, and got the account banned
github's AI anti-spam doesn't like competition from other AI anti-spam bots?

Re #33843 ^. I think this trend to trim down PR beyond reasonable is not a good one. It seems that when a PR is not attracting proper review on the totality of the effort, individual commits sometimes get pushed individually where they 1) don't quite make sense on their own and 2) each go with shallower review.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/33843 | test: add tests for private broadcast by vasild · Pull Request #33843 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub
looks like drahtbot got vaporized

darosior: Are you saying that it is not reasonable to have tests added in a followup PR? Those tests are more than half of the size of the actual code changes (tests ~500 lines, actual code changes ~1000 lines).
Why can't they be added and reviewed, with the new feature they are testing?
they can
Then leave them in the main PR?
fanquake: I explained the reasoning in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29415#issuecomment-3512327977 and https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33843#issue-3608507329

I think the comment about splitting up PRs is likely also in regards to PRs like #33565, where things are getting very granular. 1 PR per function rename, is surely pushing limits. (not exactly clear why that was reopened, given the 2 NACKs)
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/33565 | net_processing: rename RelayTransaction to better describe what it does by vasild · Pull Request #33565 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub
"not to burden the main one," isn't much of a reasoning?
What is the burden exactly
#33565 has no NACKs
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/33565 | net_processing: rename RelayTransaction to better describe what it does by vasild · Pull Request #33565 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub

Specifically for tests, I think they belong as close to the feature changes they are for, in the same PR, and even within the same PR, as close to the commit with the changes. The purpose of tests is convincing reviewers that the code changes are correct! Making reviewers go look at a different PR for that seems entirely counter-productive.
fanquake: reviewing 1500 lines vs reviewing 1000 lines

vasild: not picking on you in particular, but i think both #29415 and #33843 are examples of this trend. It sometimes makes a lot of sense to split up some commits. It seems here this is used to get changes in with less review, which i think should be resisted.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/29415 | Broadcast own transactions only via short-lived Tor or I2P connections by vasild · Pull Request #29415 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/33843 | test: add tests for private broadcast by vasild · Pull Request #33843 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub
Woops
I meant both #33567 and 33843
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/33567 | node: change a tx-relay on/off flag to enum by vasild · Pull Request #33567 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub
sipa: hmm, ok, #33843 contains everything, I guess people can look at just that for code changes and tests and ACK that one directly?
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/33843 | test: add tests for private broadcast by vasild · Pull Request #33843 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub
vasild: I guess you can interpret https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33565#issuecomment-3426393945, and the followup that agrees with it, however you like, but they are pretty clear nacks to me.
darosior: it is getting more review, not less, as mentioned here: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33565#issuecomment-3510573430
vasild: sure, but does it lead anywhere?
vasild: " I guess people can look at just that for code changes and tests and ACK that one directly?" why can't the do the same with 29415, if you just leave the tests in there?
if the tiny split-off change gets reviewed and merged, but the big feature PR doesn't get review, what's the point?
sipa: this way the code changes and the tests can be reviewed by different sets of people (the reasoning for splitting any PR into smaller pieces)
vasild: i think that is entirely backwards
those _should_ be the same people
they can still do that with both in one pr though
because the purpose of tests is convincing reviewers
(that's an argument specifically against splitting off tests, it's not an argument against splitting off things in general)
fanquake: can do the same with 29415 if it has the tests, but then there is no option to review and ACK without the tests
Anyone can ack whatever specific commit hashes they want
I haven't seen any compelling argument to defer adding tests until after adding a new feature
fair enough

Surely Github deletes this way because of the asymmetry LLMs gave to spam, but doesn't erase the data on the backend for a little while

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/a4e96cae7d3db3f7bfffd14a7fb6754ffbbc084e/src/ipc/capnp/common-types.h#L110-L128
thanks!
no problem
https://bitcoinacks.com/ down too, not that I used it a lot but thought it might be a good drahtbot alternative
bitcoi nacks
ossification is the killer feature
[bitcoin] ryanofsky opened pull request #33847: kernel: Improve logging API (master...pr/klog) https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33847

To appeal the account suspension, one has to log in to support, but login does not work, because the account is suspended. Nice job, GitHub. At least I have to option to chat with the copilot llm in the meantime :(
I've created https://support.github.com/ticket/personal/0/3891644 on my account. Let's see what happens
In theory, it would be trivial to set up a new bot account for the tasks, but that doesn't seem useful, if the account will be suspended soon after.
right... no point in that. if they decide to suspend a bot that is so integral to our project once, they might certainly do it again. especially as long as we don't know exactly what triggered it
that ticket link gives me "ticket not found". hopefully it wasn't nuked from orbit too
laanwj: accessing other people's tickets just doesn't work aiui
ohh that makes sense
